bestBHT.bht: When Jesus entered the house from the crowd, his disciples, namely Peter, asked him to interpret the parable he had spoken earlier. This shows the disciples' eagerness to gain a deeper understanding of Jesus' teachings. The fact that this conversation took place in Peter's house in Capernaum signifies the close bond between Jesus and his disciples.

Henry Alford: 17.] his disciples asked him = “Peter answered and said” Matthew.
Marvin Vincent: The disciples. Matthew says Peter. There is no discrepancy. Peter spoke for the band.
Philip Schaff: If Peter was Mark’s informant, there is modesty in this variation.
Archibald T. Robertson: When he was entered into the house from the multitude (οτε εισηλθεν εις οικον απο του οχλου). This detail in Mark alone, probably in Peter's house in Capernaum.
To the crowd Jesus spoke the parable of corban, but the disciples want it interpreted (cf. Mark 4:10; Mark 4:33).
Matthew 15:15 represents Peter as the spokesman as was usually the case.
John Gill: And when he was entered into the house...from the people...

bhtAttempts.bht: When Jesus entered the house, his disciples, particularly Peter, asked him for an interpretation of the parable he had just spoken to the crowd. This request for explanation reflects the disciples' desire to understand and deepen their knowledge of Jesus' teachings. Mark specifically mentions that this interaction took place in Peter's house in Capernaum, underscoring the close relationship between Jesus and his disciples.

Mark specifically mentions that this interaction took place in Peter's house in Capernaum.

When Jesus entered the house from the crowd, his disciples, namely Peter, asked him to interpret the parable he had spoken earlier. This shows the disciples' eagerness to gain a deeper understanding of Jesus' teachings. The fact that this conversation took place in Peter's house in Capernaum signifies the close bond between Jesus and his disciples.

When Jesus entered the house, his disciples, particularly Peter, asked him for an interpretation of the parable he had just spoken to the crowd. This request for explanation reflects the disciples' desire to understand and deepen their knowledge of Jesus' teachings. Mark specifically mentions that this interaction took place in Peter's house in Capernaum.

After Jesus entered the house, his disciples reached out to him for clarification, with Peter being the one to speak up. This reflects the typical role of Peter as the spokesperson for the group. The disciples sought a deeper understanding of the parable Jesus had shared with the crowd, demonstrating their eagerness to grasp the significance of his teachings. Mark includes the detail that this conversation occurred in Peter's house in Capernaum, which highlights the intimate connection between Jesus and his disciples.
